description.narrative: PT South Pacific Viscose (SPV or the Company), an IFC client and one of the leading producers of viscose staple fiber (VSF), is undertaking a capital expenditure program (the Project) which includes: (i) a new VSF production line together with additional utilities and auxiliaries and associated infrastructure; (ii) a wet gas sulphuric acid plant (WSA) for sulphur recovery and regeneration of sulphuric acid required in the VSF production process; (iii) incremental working capital; and (iv) regular refurbishment capital expenditure.

Sustainable development of the textiles industry: The Project supports the development of additional fiber capacities based on renewable raw material - dissolving grade wood pulp. Arguably, viscose has a lower impact on the environment compared with cotton (due to lower usage of land and water per unit of fiber) and petrochemical-based synthetic fibers (considering the bio-degradable properties of viscose and lower usage of fossil-based sources).
Job creation: The Project is expected to create 270 new job opportunities for the local economy. In addition, the Project will support the long-term growth of the Indonesian textiles sector through increased domestic production of VSF at internationally competitive quality and costs. This, in turn, will ensure the retention and growth of employment across the textiles value chain in Indonesia, textiles being one of the country's key sectors in terms of employment and foreign exchange earnings.
